entry.title: Jessie Baylin: ‘Wild Life’ (Radio Edit) (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Jessie Baylin: ‘Wild Life’ (Radio Edit)

 Best New Music

Nashville-based pop purveyor Jessie Baylin has shared the stage with artists like Stevie Nicks, The Shins, and Iron & Wine (to name just a few).

Sep. 12

entry.title: Mae Powell: ‘Where Will Love Go?’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Mae Powell: ‘Where Will Love Go?’

 Best New Music

Jazzy vocalist Mae Powell has experienced a major break-up.

Sep. 11

entry.title: Ivy: ‘Heartbreak’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Ivy: ‘Heartbreak’

 Best New Music

To say we’re excited by the prospect of new music from seminal ‘90s/2000s dreampop band Ivy would be an understatement.

Sep. 10

entry.title: JuliaWhy?: ‘Pale Blue Dot’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
JuliaWhy?: ‘Pale Blue Dot’

 Best New Music

If you are looking to stargaze, look no further than the all-female, Sydney-based shoegaze band JuliaWhy? .

Sep. 9

entry.title: Jay Som: ‘Cards On The Table’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Jay Som: ‘Cards On The Table’

 Best New Music

LA-based multi-instrumentalist, songwriter, and producer Melina Duterte — best known as Jay Som — recently announced Belong, her first new album in more than six years.

Sep. 8

entry.title: Folk Bitch Trio: ‘God's A Different Sword’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Folk Bitch Trio: ‘God's A Different Sword’

 Best New Music

The strongest link between the members of Melbourne’s Folk Bitch Trio , aside from their lifelong friendship, is music.

Sep. 5

entry.title: Rachael Yamagata: ‘Birds’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Rachael Yamagata: ‘Birds’

 Best New Music

It’s been roughly ten years since independent artist Rachael Yamagata put out a new studio album(!). Trust us, Starlit Alchemy (due October 3 via Julian Records) is worth the wait.

Sep. 4

entry.title: Jeb Loy Nichols: ‘Step In’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Jeb Loy Nichols: ‘Step In’

 Best New Music

Jeb Loy Nichols is on a lifelong journey through the roots of Americana, bringing his fresh perspective to the genre all along the way.

Sep. 3
